description: Save the current graph to a file
usage: <filename> - save the graph to a file, format is determined by the file extension (supported formats: svg, tex (LaTex via tikZ), gif, tiff, webp, pdf, png, jp(e)g, json)

description: Show the graph in a given format
usage: [<format>] - show the graph in a given format

description: Set a configuration option for the graph or print its value
usage: [<option> [<value>]] - set a configuration option for the graph or print its value

description: Reset the graph to the initial state
usage: - reset the graph to the initial state

[prefix='...'] [suffix='...'] <filename> - load a file containing commands (preceded and followed by an optional prefix and suffix; one of the delimiters ',', or " is required and must not appear in the string)

description: Load a saved graph as the current state
usage: <filename>.json - load a saved graph as the current state

description: Engage multi-line mode for the next task. Use Ctrl-D to finish and Ctrl-C to cancel
usage: - engage multi-line mode for the next task entered.

description: Save the transcript to a file
usage: <filename> - save the transcript to a file

description: Give descriptive introduction to how graphmaker is used
usage: - give descriptive introduction to how graphmaker is used

description: Give example prompts that can be run or modified to explore graphmaker
usage: - give example prompts that can be run or modified to explore graphmaker
